TopicTitle: Finally coming out of the shadows

Articles.Content:
Hi all,

I actually forgot how long ago i created my account, and have only just now gotten around to posting for the first time.

As far as my experience with KSP goes, I can't say there's another game that has commanded so much of my time and attention. Steam says I have around 200 hours logged, but i only purchased the Steam version this past January. I had purchased the non-Steam version back when it was still in Beta (i believe it was 0.86? maybe?). 

In any case, I continue to enjoy this game, and have plans for a Laythe colony at some point, so if anyone has any ideas for SSTO seaplanes, please let me know. 

See you around,

 

--miamijuggler
Welcome to the forums @miamijuggler!

You created it September 25th, 2016, according to your profile.

Hello.

4 hours ago, miamijuggler said:

i believe it was 0.86? maybe?

No, 0.86 didn't exist, you meant 0.90 "Beta than Ever". 

Also, welcome to the forums!

Now that you are out of the shadows, your solar cells should kick in and you will have plenty of power to communicate with us.

I wish I could help you with Laythe, but my first attempt failed rather miserably. I have been thinking of abandoning the idea of a land base altogether and build a sea based colony using structural fuselages as pontoons.
